tool.name: CrossKFunction

param.name: srcPoints
param.displayname: Input Origin Points Feature Dataset (e.g. bridges)

param.name: destPoints
param.displayname: Input Destination Points Feature Dataset (e.g. crashes)

param.name: network_dataset
param.dialogReference: The network dataset used to calculate the OD Cost Matrix

param.name: num_dist_bands
param.dialogReference: The number of concentric circles (or distance bands) from each point to aggregate the number of points within each concentric circle, representing the density of that specific band.

param.name: beginning_distance
param.dialogReference: Distance from the origin to the first band in meters.

param.name: distance_increment
param.dialogReference: How much to increment each band in meters

param.name: snap_distance
param.dialogReference: Snapping distance of the points onto the dataset. It will be snapped to the nearest line if it is within this threshold in meters.

param.name: output_raw_odcm_feature_class
param.dialogReference: Name of the output Raw ODCM data as a feature class

param.name: output_raw_analysis_feature_class
param.displayname: Raw Network-K Data Table (Raw Analysis Data)
param.dialogReference: Output of the raw Cross K Analysis as a feature class

param.name: output_analysis_feature_class
param.dialogReference: Name of the output Cross-K feature Class

param.name: num_permutations
param.expression: 0 Permutations (No Confidence Envelope) | 9 Permutations | 99 Permutations | 999 Permutations
param.dialogReference: Number of Random Point Permutations used to generate the OD Cost Matrix

param.name: coordinate_system
param.displayname: Output Network Dataset Length Projected Coordinate System
param.dialogReference: Output Network Dataset Length Projected Coordinate System

param.name: num_points_field
param.dialogReference: Name of a field in the network dataset's edge source from which the number of random points should be derived.

tool.summary:
The Cross K Function tool that allows the user to find crash clustering and dispersion at different distance bands using Dr. Ghazan Khan’s modified version of the Ripley’s K Function. For a given set of crash points, this function determines deviations from spatial homogeneity at different distances along a road network.

Cross-K analysis, is comprised of local statistics at individual crash locations to identify individual crashes as part of a statistically significant clustered (hotspot), dispersed (coldspot), or random point pattern. The methods under the crash cluster analysis category were developed based on the principles of the K-Function method in network space.
tool.usage:
See parameters for description for Required and Optional inputs.

Outputs a table and a database of raw data which is used to generate the Network K Function.
